text: {{Infobox settlement | name = North-West | native_name = | native_name_lang = tsn | type = District | image_skyline = Maun Botswana2.jpg | image_alt = | image_caption = Maun | nickname = | motto = | image_map = Botswana - North-West.svg | map_alt = | map_caption = Location within Botswana | mapsize = frameless | coordinates = | coordinates_footnotes = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | established_title = | established_date = | founder = | named_for = | seat_type = Capital | seat = Maun | government_footnotes = | leader_party = | leader_title = | leader_name = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 129930 | area_note = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 142970 | population_as_of = 2001 census | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = | population_note = | timezone1 = Central Africa Time | utc_offset1 = +2 | postal_code_type = | postal_code = | area_code_type = | area_code = | footnotes = }} The North-West District or Ngamiland is a district in Botswana. The capital city is Maun. Ngamiland is subdivided into Ngamiland East, Ngamiland West and Ngamiland Delta (Okavango). Important tourist attractions include Tsodilo Hills, the Moremi Game Reserve, and the Gchwihaba (Drotsky's) Caves. ==References== Category:Districts of Botswana
title: North-West District (Botswana)
